bientity_condition.description: If specified, this condition type will only evaluate to true if this condition is fulfilled by either or both the '*_actor_*' and '*_target_*' entities.
bientity_condition.markdownDescription: If specified, this condition type will only evaluate to true if this condition is fulfilled by either or both the '*_actor_*' and '*_target_*' entities.

type.description:
## Riding Root --- [Entity Condition Type](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/entity_condition_types/riding_root) Checks whether the '__actor__' entity is indirectly riding the '__target__' entity. Type ID: `origins:riding_root` --- ### üìù Note In the context for this entity condition type, the '__actor__' entity is the passenger and the entity that invoked the condition while the '__target__' is the entity that is being indirectly ridden (at the start of the riding chain). --- ### Examples ```json "condition": { "type": "origins:riding_root" } ``` This example will check if the '__actor__' entity is riding an entity.
```json "condition": { "type": "origins:riding_root", "bientity_condition": { "type": "origins:target_condition", "condition": { "type": "origins:entity_type", "entity_type": "minecraft:pig" } } } ``` This example will check if the '__actor__' entity is riding a pig. This will also check if the '__actor__' entity is riding the passenger(s) of a pig.
